name: Ashbourne House Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked into Ashbourne on recommendation from Cape Town, and it certainly lived up to expectations. Beautiful place in quiet location and only a short walk to restaurants/shops. Delicious breakfasts (to my husbands delight he was asked how he wanted his bacon cooking!), and very helpful owners, Russell & John. They went out of their way to help us with bookings and recommendations, both locally and for the last few days of our trip to SA. We really felt that, apart from making Ashbourne House special, they wanted the rest of our trip to be special too. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent recommendation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My second visit and I am still very impressed by the immaculate surroundings, comfort and quality of the accommodation and the very high housekeeping standards. Owners are personable, friendly and a mine of information on local activities and restaurants. It is an absolute delight to stay here. The freshly cooked to order breakfast are a great start to the day.
reviews.title: A perfect B&B - immaculate, comfortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Five minutes walk from all the restaurants in Franschoek, the room we stayed in was so comfortable. The garden and pool are an exquisite oasis. Some of the rooms are around the pool. The breakfast is a gourmet delight of local and organic produce. The hosts John and Russell could not be more welcoming.
reviews.title: In Franschoek, don't stay anywhere else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 5 nights at the Ashbourne House and found it outstanding in every way. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The manager’s encyclopedic knowledge of the local area and willingness to help with recommendations for attractions and bookings for wine tours and meal reservations was a very special touch. The Rooms are very modern and spacious with beautiful marble and glass bathrooms, heated towel bars and heated floors. The cooked to order breakfasts were delicious and offered plenty of selection. We will definitely go again and recommend it to others!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Experiencd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accommodation to rival UK 5 star hotels (yes, I've stayed in a few). Quiet location yet a short walk to all the best restaurants. Breakfast and service to dream about.
reviews.title: An absolute gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ashbourne House is a small, recently nicely renovated with great attention to detail. It is quiet and relaxed and the staff/owners are helpful and friendly, with good tips on things to do and places to see or eat. The lodge is an easy stroll to the main shopping street, full of restaurants, boutiques and local African artifacts etc.
reviews.title: Beautifully appointed guest house in the centre of Franschhoek

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Touring the local wineries is a must, with a strategically placed lunch somewhere in the middle. We took the recommendation of the lodge and hired bikes just down the street from the lodge. It was a great way to see a bit of the country side at a slower pace and no problem with drink driving! The restaurant at Klein Dauphine (ask the lodge for the name) is a great spot for a relaxed lunch in the garden in the shade of under a big old oak tree. Great way to spend an afternoon.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ashbourne House for 2 nights while on honeymoon in South Africa in March. We were greeted by Sara who was very welcoming on arrival and throughout our stay. We were given a tour of the beautiful guest house and then shown to our lovely room which overlooked the pool. We mentioned on arrival that we would like to do a wine tour and Sara was very efficient in calling the company to get us booked on. We had lovely breakfasts each morning, and found Sara to be very helpful in recommending restaurants and making reservations on our behalf. There are lots of restaurants in the local area which were all in walking distance and we always felt safe. There is off street parking if you’ve hired a car. We really enjoyed our stay at Ashbourne House and would definitely stay there again in the future. We would highly recommend it as a place to stay while exploring the winelands.
reviews.title: Beautiful Guest House that lived up to all expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just stayed at Ashbourne House for two nights and it is everything every other reviewer has written, well situated, immaculately clean, warm welcome, knowledgeable hosts and filling breakfasts! We ate at all three restaurants recommended by John and were not disappointed at all. We also visited Dieu Donne at John's suggestion to watch the sunset which was stunning.
reviews.title: Beautiful guesthouse in lovely Franschhoek

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thank you for making us so welcome, we will definitely be back.
reviews.title: A peaceful and welcoming retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortnately we could only stay one night but it was delighful. We had one of the rooms around the pool - it was spacious and was furnished to a standard which far exceeded our expectations. We met John at breakfast and he was very helpful in his recommendations of wine estates to visit (go to Glenwood - off the beaten track but well worth it). A delicious breakfast set us up well for a day of wine tasting! Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautifully stylish guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Franschhoek without pre-arranged accomodation and happened to try Ashbourne House. The location is perfect, less than 5 mins walk to the main street and very safe to get around by foot. The views from our upper deck room were amazing. The room itself was luxiourous and huge! The only slight problem was that the TV was difficult to view from the bed. Breakfast was lovely. John & Russell are great hosts, who know the area well, and were very helpful offering advice and information. We ate at Ryans Kitchen, it was really good. The Vineyards and Manors are all nearby the guesthouse. Great place to relax and would definately recommend this place to others.
reviews.title: A fantastic place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 5 days at the inn. It had been recommended to us by another innkeeper in Cape Town. We were not disappointed on any level. As the other reviewers have said, the rooms were great - spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was one of the best 'inn' breakfasts we've had on our trip. Plenty to eat and prepared to order. And the hosts... they were great. Russell and John are not only personable, but very well acquainted with all the local - and most distant activities one would want. A delight to speak with too. Even rainy days didn't stump them for suggestions.
reviews.title: Perfect choice, all the way around...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: Franschhoek is a delightful town. With its obvious draw being wineries, there is so much more to do and see. Daily exploration trips were typically the order of the day for us. Russell and John offered many options. We were never bored.
reviews.title: A clear winner in Franschhoek

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only regret is we didn't stay longer...
reviews.title: Relaxing and a great nights sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Ashbourne House during our visit to the winelands. We selected Ashbourne House based on its proximity to the Tasting Room, where we had dinner. The Ashbourne has a very attentive staff, spacious rooms (where we really enjoyed the heated tiled bathrooms), and a great breakfast. We would definitely go again and highly recommend the guest house if you are looking to stay over night in the winelands.
reviews.title: Quality guest house in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent six great nights at Ashbourne House. The bedroom was large and very well appointed with a very comfortable and again very large bed. The en suite bathroom was quite luxurious. We had a balcony where we could sit out watching the resident sun birds flitting to and fro. The host, John, was very knowledgeable of the area and provided great restaurant and wine estate recommendations. The inclusive break fast was very enjoyable with a good choice of hot or cold options. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Exceptional Ashbourne House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all an excellent stay.
reviews.title: So relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ashbourne House on our first night in South Africa and could not have chosen a better place to acclimatise and relax after our journey.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our garden room overlooked the pool and was extremely comfortable. A short walk took us to the wonderful restaurants of Franschhoek in one direction and up into the vineyards in the other. Russell and John could not have been more welcoming and their recommendations for eating and walking were spot on. And the home cooked breakfasts set us up perfectly for the day!!
reviews.title: Outstanding

aka: Ashbourne House Guest House Hotel Franschhoek
description: A meticulously restored Colonial retreat set in tranquil gardens with soaring mountain views in the heart of Franschhoek village, the food and wine capital of South Africa. Luxuriously appointed air-conditioned bedrooms, each with own entrance and private patio. Soak up the sunshine and pure mountain air at the secluded heated pool. Stroll to the village with its vibrant cosmopolitan atmosphere. Delicious a la carte breakfasts. Parking. Limited smoking. Children 16+. TGCSA 4-Star Guest House.
